alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 4:38PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SHANNON...DENT...NORTHEASTERN TEXAS AND CENTRAL PHELPS COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM CDT... At 437 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles north of Licking to 7 miles northeast of Summersville. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Rolla, Current River State Park, Ozark National Scenic Riverways, Echo Bluff State Park, Montauk State Park, Salem, St. James, Licking, Eminence, Summersville, Bunker, Edgar Springs, Lenox, Montauk, Jadwin, Beulah, Howes Mill, Midridge, Lake Spring and Gladden. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 193 and 199. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
